intro: Centaurium pulchellum subsp. meyeri, commonly known as the Meyer's redweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, bright red flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are visited by various pollinators, including bees and flies.
